original_text: We have presented spectrally resolved femtosecond three-pulse photon echo measurements on Zn(II)–OEP, Ni(II)–OEP and Co(II)–OEP. Increased degree of freedom in scans of time delays allows one to separate and extract specific type of spectroscopic information in complex molecules by studying spectral and temporal evolution of the photon echo signals. By varying the population times, population relaxation dynamics and inhomogeneous broadening is revealed in the photon echo spectra. Time-integrated photon echo signals show two different timescales. The electronic relaxation timescale is found to be sub 50fs whereas the timescale for intramolecular vibrational relaxation, occurring in Q00 band, was found to be over a picosecond for Co(II)–OEP and Ni(II)–OEP and within a picosecond for Zn(II)–OEP.
original_translation: Hemos presentado mediciones de eco de fotones de tres pulsos femtosegundos resueltos espectralmente en Zn(II)–OEP, Ni(II)–OEP y Co(II)–OEP. Un mayor grado de libertad en los barridos de retardos temporales permite separar y extraer un tipo específico de información espectroscópica en moléculas complejas mediante el estudio de la evolución espectral y temporal de las señales de eco de fotones. Al variar los tiempos de población, se revela la dinámica de relajación de población y el ensanchamiento inhomogéneo en los espectros de eco de fotones. Las señales de eco de fotones integradas en el tiempo muestran dos escalas de tiempo diferentes. Se encontró que la escala de tiempo de relajación electrónica es inferior a 50 fs, mientras que la escala de tiempo para la relajación vibracional intramolecular, que ocurre en la banda Q00, fue de más de un picosegundo para Co(II)–OEP y Ni(II)–OEP y dentro de un picosegundo para Zn(II)–OEP.

By varying the population times, population relaxation dynamics and inhomogeneous broadening is revealed in the photon echo spectra.
Time-integrated photon echo signals show two different timescales.

The electronic relaxation timescale is found to be sub 50fs whereas the timescale for intramolecular vibrational relaxation, occurring in Q00 band, was found to be over a picosecond for Co(II)–OEP and Ni(II)–OEP and within a picosecond for Zn(II)–OEP.

population times.translated_text:
Hemos presentado mediciones de eco de fotones de tres pulsos femtosegundos resueltos espectralmente en Zn(II)–OEP, Ni(II)–OEP y Co(II)–OEP. Un mayor grado de libertad en los barridos de retardos temporales permite separar y extraer un tipo específico de información espectroscópica en moléculas complejas mediante el estudio de la evolución espectral y temporal de las señales de eco de fotones. Al variar los
tiempos de población
, se revela la dinámica de relajación de población y el ensanchamiento inhomogéneo en los espectros de eco de fotones. Las señales de eco de fotones integradas en el tiempo muestran dos escalas de tiempo diferentes. Se encontró que la escala de tiempo de relajación electrónica es inferior a 50 fs, mientras que la escala de tiempo para la relajación vibracional intramolecular, que ocurre en la banda Q00, fue de más de un picosegundo para Co(II)–OEP y Ni(II)–OEP y dentro de un picosegundo para Zn(II)–OEP.

original_annotated_sentences: We have presented spectrally resolved femtosecond three-pulse photon echo measurements on Zn(II)–OEP, Ni(II)–OEP and Co(II)–OEP.

Increased degree of freedom in scans of time delays allows one to separate and extract specific type of spectroscopic information in complex molecules by studying spectral and temporal evolution of the photon echo signals.
By varying the population times, population relaxation dynamics and inhomogeneous broadening is revealed in the photon echo spectra.
Time-integrated photon echo signals show two different timescales.

The electronic relaxation timescale is found to be sub 50fs whereas the timescale for intramolecular vibrational relaxation, occurring in
Q00 band
, was found to be over a picosecond for Co(II)–OEP and Ni(II)–OEP and within a picosecond for Zn(II)–OEP.
original_annotated_samples:
The electronic relaxation timescale is found to be sub 50fs whereas the timescale for intramolecular vibrational relaxation, occurring in
Q00 band
, was found to be over a picosecond for Co(II)–OEP and Ni(II)–OEP and within a picosecond for Zn(II)–OEP.

banda Q00
, fue de más de un picosegundo para Co(II)–OEP y Ni(II)–OEP y dentro de un picosegundo para Zn(II)–OEP.

spectrally resolved femtosecond three-pu.translated_key: mediciones de eco de fotones de tres pulsos femtosegundos resueltos espectralmente
original_annotated_sentences:
We have presented
spectrally resolved femtosecond three-pulse photon echo measurements
on Zn(II)–OEP, Ni(II)–OEP and Co(II)–OEP.

Increased degree of freedom in scans of time delays allows one to separate and extract specific type of spectroscopic information in complex molecules by studying spectral and temporal evolution of the photon echo signals.
By varying the population times, population relaxation dynamics and inhomogeneous broadening is revealed in the photon echo spectra.
Time-integrated photon echo signals show two different timescales.

The electronic relaxation timescale is found to be sub 50fs whereas the timescale for intramolecular vibrational relaxation, occurring in Q00 band, was found to be over a picosecond for Co(II)–OEP and Ni(II)–OEP and within a picosecond for Zn(II)–OEP.

spectrally resolved femtosecond three-pulse photon echo measurements
on Zn(II)–OEP, Ni(II)–OEP and Co(II)–OEP.
